qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.bernoulli_distribution module¶

The Univariate Bernoulli Distribution.

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.bernoulli_distribution.BernoulliDistribution(p, low=0, high=1)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.univariate_distribution.UnivariateDistribution

The Univariate Bernoulli Distribution.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'Bernoulli Distribution', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'BernoulliDistribution_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'p': {'type': 'number', 'default': 0.5}, 'low': {'type': 'number', 'default': 0}, 'high': {'type': 'number', 'default': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'BernoulliDistribution'}¶
build(qc, q, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Adds corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled(qc, q, q_control, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Adds corresponding controlled sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_control – control qubit
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled_inverse(qc, q, q_control, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_control – control qubit
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

Adds controlled, inverse, power of corresponding circuit. May be overridden if a more efficient implementation is possible

qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_distribution module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for multivariate distributions.

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_distribution.MultivariateDistribution(num_qubits, probabilities, low, high)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.utils.circuit_factory.CircuitFactory

This module contains the definition of a base class for multivariate distributions. (Interface for discrete bounded uncertainty models assuming an equidistant grid)

__init__(num_qubits, probabilities, low, high)[source]¶

Constroctor

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (list of list) – assigns qubits to dimensions
  • probabilities – map - maps index tuples to probabilities
  • low (list) – lowest value per dimension
  • high (list) – highest value per dimension
build(qc, q, q_ancillas=None, params=None)[source]¶

Adds corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled(qc, q, q_control, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Parameters:

  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_control – control qubit
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_normal_distribution module¶

The Multivariate Normal Distribution.

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_normal_distribution.MultivariateNormalDistribution(num_qubits, low, high, mu=None, sigma=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_distribution.MultivariateDistribution

The Multivariate Normal Distribution.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'Multivariate Normal Distribution', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'MultivariateNormalDistribution_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_target_qubits': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'mu': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'sigma': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'low': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'high': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'MultivariateNormalDistribution'}¶
__init__(num_qubits, low, high, mu=None, sigma=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Circuit Factory to build a circuit that represents a multivariate normal distribution.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (array or list) – representing number of qubits per dimension
  • low (array or list) – representing lower bounds per dimension
  • high (array or list) – representing upper bounds per dimension
  • mu (array or list) – representing expected values
  • sigma (array or list) – representing co-variance matrix
build(qc, q, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Adds corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.random_distribution module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for random distributions. A random distribution could be used for constructing Amplification Estimation tasks.

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.random_distribution.RandomDistribution(num_target_qubits)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.utils.circuit_factory.CircuitFactory, qiskit_aqua.pluggable.Pluggable, abc.ABC

The abstract Random Distribution

  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

Adds inverse power of corresponding circuit. May be overridden if a more efficient implementation is possible

build_power(qc, q, power, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.univariate_distribution module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for univariate distributions.

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.univariate_distribution.UnivariateDistribution(num_target_qubits, probabilities, low=0, high=1)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.random_distribution.RandomDistribution

This module contains the definition of a base class for univariate distributions. (Interface for discrete bounded uncertainty models assuming an equidistant grid)

build(qc, q, q_ancillas=None, params=None)[source]¶

Adds corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit

class qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.MultivariateNormalDistribution(num_qubits, low, high, mu=None, sigma=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.random_distributions.multivariate_distribution.MultivariateDistribution

The Multivariate Normal Distribution.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'Multivariate Normal Distribution', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'MultivariateNormalDistribution_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_target_qubits': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'mu': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'sigma': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'low': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'high': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'MultivariateNormalDistribution'}¶
__init__(num_qubits, low, high, mu=None, sigma=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Circuit Factory to build a circuit that represents a multivariate normal distribution.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (array or list) – representing number of qubits per dimension
  • low (array or list) – representing lower bounds per dimension
  • high (array or list) – representing upper bounds per dimension
  • mu (array or list) – representing expected values
  • sigma (array or list) – representing co-variance matrix
